required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nicotine Pharmacokinetic Profile and Safety of the Tobacco Heating System 2.2 (THS 2.2)
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Open-label, Randomized, Controlled, Crossover Study to Investigate the Nicotine Pharmacokinetic Profile and Safety of THS 2.2 Following Single Use in Smoking, Healthy Subjects Compared to Conventional Cigarettes and Nicotine Gum

brief_summary.textblock: The overall goal of the study is to evaluate the pharmacokinetic (PK) profile (rate and the amount of nicotine absorbed) following a single use of the THS 2.2 compared to the PK profiles from a single use of a conventional cigarette (CC) and from a single use of nicotine gum in a Japanese population.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label

primary_outcome.measure: Nicotine maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) and area under the nicotine concentration-time curve from start of product use to time of last quantifiable concentration [AUC(0-last)]
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the amount of nicotine absorbed from THS 2.2 relative to CC, following a single use of THS 2.2 and CC.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be randomized to receive either THS 2.2 followed by CC, or CC folowed by THS 2.2
Subjects will be randomized to receive either THS 2.2 followed by NRT gum, or NRT gum folowed by THS 2.2

intervention.description: Single use of subject's own CC
Single administration of NRT 2 mg gum (Nicorette Â® 2mg)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is Japanese.
- Smoking, healthy subject as judged by the Investigator.
- Subject smokes at least 10 commercially available CCs per day (no brand restrictions) for the last 4 weeks, based on self-reporting.
- Subject does not plan to quit smoking in the next 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- As per Investigator judgment, the subject cannot participate in the study for any reason (e.g., medical, psychiatric, and/or social reason).
- The subject has received medication within 14 days or within 5 half-lives of a drug (whichever is longer) which has an impact on CYP2A6 activity.
- For women: subject is pregnant or is breast feeding.
- For women: subject does not agree to use an acceptable method of effective contraception.
